website_summaries.verdict: It's not as powerful as some of its electric-powered counterparts, but owners rave about this chopper's efficiency and practicality.
pros: This hand-powered unit stands out from competitors thanks to its reliable and stress-free operation – not to mention its portability
cons: Sharp blade edges and a small space make some users afraid to fully clean the chopper

website_summaries.verdict: This onion chopper works like a manual food processor, giving you more control over the size and texture.
pros: Chops fruit, vegetables, boneless meats, herbs, nuts, and ice
Pull cord to spin chopping blades
Includes storage lid to keep ingredients in the container
Blades, bowl, and storage lid are top-rack dishwasher safe
Effectively chops 1 cup at a time
Can easily control size of chopped veggies
cons: Some parts are not dishwasher safe and are difficult to keep clean

customer_reviews.title: Ordered it last week, used it tonight for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it last week, used it tonight for the first time. Chopped the carrots very well and arm workout was a bonus. However I then chopped some onion and when I tried to open it to take chopped onion out, the top layer of the lid came off. Bottom layer of lid stuck solid into container. I broke two nails and bent a knife trying to open the thing but couldn't no matter hard I tried. Ended up tossing whole thing in trash, onion still inside.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: I cannot say say enough about this wonderful little chopper
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this wonderful little chopper. It is perfect for chopping onions, peppers, cauliflower for my salads and almost anything else you can think of chopping. It's lightweight but sturdy and very easy to clean. Large enough but not so large that it takes up a lot of room to store. I can just put it in the dishwasher if I want but I usually hand wash because it's so easy to clean. I really hated getting out my Cuisinart for chopping an onion so I usually just bought them already chopped rather than to do that. This little gadget is cute and I swear you will actually enjoy using it! Great product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Samiam

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT last
customer_reviews.text: While we loved using this, and my son especially was a huge help with it...it did not last more than 10 uses. :( The pull cord must've stripped and it did nothing. There is no way to get in to the top assembly to fix what was wrong (if it was even fixable). We had to toss it. Money wasted, lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clugston

customer_reviews.title: Item not working. Need replacement.
customer_reviews.text: It worked properly till now. But the blades are not rotating any more. When checked the connection between the rope and blades is not working properly. There is no way to fix it. If this still under warranty, please replace this item. I can send the item with me back to you if you can send a return label or give me the return address. I will pay for the postage. Regards Bhargav Devarakonda
customer_reviews.author: Tushara

customer_reviews.title: Love/hate this...the top is the issue.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one several years ago and the top broke right away and they replaced it after I sent emails and photos. So when that one needed replacing I bought another just last March. So less than a year. That one has just broken (the plastic pull handle, which is vital) and although the bowl and blade are great I will NOT order another. I expect it to last longer than a year! This is really a shame because when it doesn't break it is really great. I used it all the time. By the way, I ALWAYS hand washed the top so it is NOT user error.
customer_reviews.author: PGlenny

customer_reviews.title: this is an absolute garbage. hard for assembly and stopped working only after ...
customer_reviews.text: this is an absolute garbage. hard for assembly and stopped working only after 1 use. don't waste your money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few tries...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product in theory, however we only got to use this one a few times before it broke (just a few days after the return window closed). Posting this to see if the seller can respond, Amazon wouldn't give me an opportunity to reach out to them directly since the return window passed. This thing does chop of veggies of all kinds quite well, but unfortunately whatever mechanism on the inside of the lid attached the string to the spinner broke (the string is still attached find and pulls with normal force, but no spinning occurs from the main catch for the agitator)
customer_reviews.author: Sean Amelingmeier

customer_reviews.title: concept is great - not sure of the actual use
customer_reviews.text: quite disappointed - because you have to pull the rope so it chops up whatever you are cutting. and pull the rope and pull the rope. It is quite inconvenient and quite hard on my arm and hand to use because of arthritis. AND be careful the blades are extremely SHARP - which of course they need to be to chop stuff up - to be fair I used it for chopping up different kinds of nuts for baking - and that is difficult. probably would be better to use one something not quite so hard.
customer_reviews.author: Diane H

customer_reviews.title: This will change your life
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of parties. I help people give parties. I discovered this chopper at a client's home, bought 1 immediately and bought them for everyone that Christmas. It works like a salad spinner and is sooooo easy. The more you pull the ring, the more finely it chops. You can even toss in an avocado, tomato, and onions, and VOILA! Instant guacamole in a moment! Chop onions quickly and with no tears. Other choppers are kind of a pain to use, to assemble, to clean, but I love this little chopper. It's fun! The Williams Sonoma store was out of stock - luckily - as it is a third of the price on Amazon. Happy chopping.
customer_reviews.author: J. Beggs

customer_reviews.title: Best chopping tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I'm ordering as my mom and sister stole one each when they came to my house instantly loved it. The best thing to have in your kitchen hands down. Very easy to use and clean and chops all sorts of stuff with great ease. I've used it to chop onions, carrots, green chillies and even cabbage! The rubber grip at the bottom allows it to sit firmly on the counter top while you can just pull the handle gently to chop almost anything. Highly recommended every one get it.
customer_reviews.author: Harsha Aduri

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this new kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: Just received the Chopper, and our twenty something kid grabbed it and started chopping up onions, potatoes, celery and everything else that wasn't moving. The chopper really does a nice job, and quickly. Easy to clean, and the bowl comes with a lid to allow you to store your chopped material in. I plan to use it to make up salads, especially chicken salad, which used to require a lot of hand chopping.
customer_reviews.author: NPR MANTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I loved mine so much I got one for my mother in law. The more times you pull, the smaller the pieces are. I used it once for a dressing, worked perfectly. I usually use it for onions. It has left a large piece of onion without cutting once or twice but I still really like it, even if the blade and lid aren't dishwasher safe. They're not hard to clean but I mean, if they actually were dishwasher safe it would be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Eduarda Mattos

customer_reviews.title: Minces all veggies to a fine sauce, if desired
customer_reviews.text: Minces all veggies to a fine sauce, if desired. Quick and clean. I like my onion minced really fine to get the best taste on a dish, especially on soups. This is nice. It took me a while to start using it, because I was using other devices, but now I wish I had started using this as soon as I got it. Very easy to take apart and clean. Comes with a neat lid for storage of ingredients in the plastic container. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Electrical Residential Service

customer_reviews.title: ITEM BOX DAMAGED, purchased as gift.  UPDATE -- friend loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Short time, purchased as a gift, but too short to request replacement. The outside shipping box wasn't damaged a bit, but the Food Chopper packaging inside was dented in one place and torn in a corner. Item looks fine, seemed sturdy, but looks like it was purchased at a flea market. I think my friend will love it for chopped salads. I'm just getting too many items from Amazon that are somehow not pristine when I get them, as they're packaged too hurriedly or too cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: W-RO

customer_reviews.title: Great little  kitchen tool that needs to improve the quality
customer_reviews.text: After a year using it, I’d have to revise my earlier 4 star review because the quality didn’t seem to last longer than it should (for what it’s worth at $20 +, it ought to last a couple of years at least particularly if you don’t use it daily) . It hasn’t totally broken down yet but the rope gets stuck from time to time amongst other issues. Otherwise it’s a handy little kitchen tool that needs little space (which is one of my focus as I absolutely hate bulky clumsy stuffs to clutter my not so big kitchen and countertop).
customer_reviews.author: Sammie

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a few months
customer_reviews.text: Did its job well for about 4 months. But the pull mechanism completely broke after that, and the product became useless. I switched to an electric shopper afterwards, which works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex T

customer_reviews.title: No more crying when cutting onions.
customer_reviews.text: It is good for someone like me who is not huge into cooking. I just want the onion to get cut without my eyes crying. However, it does not cut the onion cleanly. It more like minces the onion. A professional would not approve. Also, you can not put a full onion in at once. I usually have to put it in 1/4 at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Waite

customer_reviews.title: No more tears!
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely sensitive to the juice from onions and chopping them has been the bane of my existence. For the way they handle onions alone, I would give this little champ 5 stars. Works very well on even harder things like butternut squash, which impressed me! I also love that it's pull string powered so I can take it camping or on our boat without worrying about changing batteries or having to plug anything in. Love that it comes with a lid to store leftovers.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I have to deduct a star because ti's a bit of a pain as I think it fares best with hand washing
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this on the rare occasion he cooks and switched to this after using the punch-down-to-chop style for years. It's a neat kitchen gadget with ultra sharp blades--watch out when washing! Chops the heck out of whatever you put in there with minimal pulls, but since I get to do cleanup after his cooking, I have to deduct a star because ti's a bit of a pain as I think it fares best with hand washing: the blades are very sharp, as mentioned, and the lid seems to trap water somehow.
customer_reviews.author: MThings

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: Updates: bought a 2nd one. Didn't learn my lesson. Same thing happened. Stopped working after 1 use. It worked phenomenally well - ONCE. After that, the spinning mechanism when I pull the handle doesn't communicate with the piece on the inside of the lid that's supposed to spin in order to turn the blades. Now the whole thing is useless. I'm back to using my beat-up Oster blender which has held up during the years. I went for this hoping for a simpler, less noisy, quick solution for chopping and was highly disappointed by its short life.
customer_reviews.author: Mimo

customer_reviews.title: Could not get this to work.
customer_reviews.text: My attempt at using this chopper failed. All I got was puree. Evidently have to chop veggies small so what is the point of having a chopper if you are doing the chopping before you use? I also cut my finger on blade which is very sharp and I realize I should have known this but still an alert should state when removing blade, be very careful. Fortunately when I contacted customer service, they understood that I was not happy and offered me a credit. Good for you, Amazon Customer Service
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new small manual chopper, and this works perfect for what I need. It's easy to store, holds a good bit of food, and the puller is easy. Some say it's not durable, I've only used it for tomatoes and onions so far which is mainly what I need it for anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Paula S.

customer_reviews.title: The innovation is this product is beyond amazing
customer_reviews.text: Best ever to chop my onions and tomatoes. I like this product’s easiness and sturdiness. It’s very easy to pull and gives the perfect blend. Size of the veggies been cut depends on how fine or coarse you want them to. The more fine you want more pulls and it is so easy. No wire to plug in. All one single set. I am in love with it. Will order one for my mother and sister soon.
customer_reviews.author: Vidhi Saxena

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Sturdy and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I love this chopper. I can mince an onion in just seconds. Really saves time. I saw it on a sale and thought it would be fairly flimsy due to the cost but I was very surprised. It is made of a very sturdy plastic. I dropped the bowl and it bounced several times. I was sure it would be cracked but it was fine I use this very often and will probably buy one for each of my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: azannah11

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little kitchen appliance. I use it mainly for chopping onions and tomatoes. It chops the onions pretty small after just about 10 - 15 pulls. It works well too with spinach. I used it regularly for over 2 years before I broke of the top (I overloaded it and pulled too hard). I bought a replacement and still use the original blades. I'd say this is one of the few small kitchen appliances I actually use.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: This thing really works
customer_reviews.text: I was a long time "slap chop" user and when it finally bit the dust I went searching for a replacement. I settled on this small food chopper based on reviews. I can tell you that you will love it. First attempt I put in half of a red onion and within 2 pulls of the cord the onion was ready for a salad or salsa. After 4 pulls, the onion was minced and ready for topping on chili dogs. Used it to chop and mince an entire bunch of parsley, boiled eggs, and celery. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: JWaddell

customer_reviews.title: Extremely efficient and effective
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd gadget, my mom has one, and so does my grandmother. It is super helpful and I really like how it cuts my preparation time down to half. I can use it with a variety of vegetables, but mostly for chopping onions and finely chopped garlic. Dishwasher safe and thats a bonus, yay! The only thing I don't like about it is that the top cover should only be wiped with a damp cloth, I do find the smell of onions and garlic to exist even after wiping. I did however give it a quick rinse with soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: This little thing works!
customer_reviews.text: I use this little thing ALL of the time. So easy to chop/slice things up quickly without pulling large food processor out, if it’s a large job then use large processor. If you are the fence about ordering it, then I would say try it. I use it for for carrots, radishes, tomatoes, cauliflower, hard boiled eggs, nuts and many other things. You do have to cut things small enough to go in it, but that is really no problem. It is small and doesn’t take up much room for storage. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Birdie

customer_reviews.title: No more tears.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I’ve started preparing a lot of meals. I hated the all of the chopping and dicing. No more. My dreams of little to no preparation is here. This machine is awesome, quick, and easy. I love it. No more tears.
customer_reviews.author: flem2go

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! The best onion chopper I have ever used! I’ve gotten a few things to help chop onions but they are always a beast to clean. When I used this I was blown away and it was so easy to clean. Best Buy!! And it’s great quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Steffany Winder

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I waited so long to purchase this. I bought an expensive food processor a while back, but this cuts my fruits and vegetables so easy when I’m cooking. I haven’t used my food processor since I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This is convenient! Easier than taking food processor out and cleaning it. WATCH OUT though, it’s very sharp and the first time I washed it I cut myself. I like it! Fast, convenient and easy
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: 1 pull 2 pulls whala!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love using this! Makes prepping veggies and chopping a breeze. I used to dread having to chop up stuff with a knife on a chopping board but with this it's SO easy and fast! I don't mind chopping anything anymore. Just 2-3 pulls and your done onto to the next! Haha
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the versatility of this product. I can chop so much with it. I also how it doesn’t require electricity, so I can use it if the power goes out. I’ve really enjoyed this product and have had no problems even though I read that some people did. I am very careful washing the top piece with the string, making sure it doesn’t get too wet. I use a damp paper towel to clean it. Then I put the blade and chopping container in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Gaudin

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my mom. She used it twice then ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mom. She used it twice then went on vacation. Came back & used one more time & it broke! String pull thing no longer functions within the lid!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that it didn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this product a lot until it stopped working. I’ve only had it for 4 months. Back when I purchased it a few months ago the price was only around $12. I can’t believe it’s gotten so high in just a few months time.
customer_reviews.author: Lexy

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is amazing!! No more tears when slicing onions! I cut my onion into fourths, put it in the chopper, just a few pulls and they were all sliced perfectly! Ordering another for our camper!
customer_reviews.author: ak2012

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen gadget you never knew you needed!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this chopper. It was gifted to me about three years ago and changed my life! I use it the most on onions, getting a super fine dice without having to chop them by hand... and no tears! I love using it on carrots for my fried rice, too. I just love this handy little gadget but be sure to be carful when cleaning the blade. Very easy to slice your finger if you are rushing. It’s sturdy and has held up with regular use for the past few years. Just bought this one for my mom because she’s been telling me for months she wants one.
customer_reviews.author: Redd

customer_reviews.title: Love my Veggie Chop!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another chopper (that shall remain unnamed) and I must say, I like it a whole lot better. Not only was it cheaper in cost, easy to use, and did more (chops and purees) but its way easier to clean. The only flaw (if you can call this a flaw) is that if you tighten the lid too hard (thinking that if you don't its going to not work correctly), it's difficult to get it off. But see that's a flaw that's really a plus cause if you only slightly close it, it's locked tight for sure and after you finish you can unlock it easily. Easy on, easy off!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: So easy and FUN...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, my family fights over who gets to make the salsa because this thing makes it so fun. Seriously, they see it on the counter and my kids argue over who gets to help me--of course I have to cut and peel everything, ha! But it's so simple, you just pull on it several times and it chops away. My only complaint if I had one is that it's smaller than I expected. It makes a nice serving of salsa but if I put Avacado in it, it's full to the max. It's not too bad to clean either. I don't put in dishwasher. I brush wash it with hot soapy water, rinse/dry and put back together to store away.
customer_reviews.author: I. Ski

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase! Did not even get to use once! Tried to use it the day that I received it but did not work at ALL! The blades do not move not one bit when the string is pulled. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm and is a smart purchase
customer_reviews.text: I went to a PC party at a friends and almost paid an obscene amount of money for one of these, but I just couldn't do (we are talking $50+!) and when I found this on Amazon I figured I would give it a try. This thing is awesome and I feel much, MUCH better about this purchase than if I had bought the PC version.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Amber

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT. I am constantly chopping up food to cook with and this chopped has made my cooking experience so much better. It is so easy to use and can cut things into bigger chunks or all the way down to teeny tiny pieces. Highly recommend. Use at least 20 times since purchasing and no issues
customer_reviews.author: Linda E. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Works very well on onions. Just don't expect perfect dice shapes.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is shockingly good at chopping onions. Put 4 onion quarters around the blades and pull ten times on the drawstring and you've got finely chopped onions. Unfortunately, it's finely chopped onions or nothing: no diced no julienned, no rings, etc. So this is great if you just want to make some spaghetti sauce or something (me, most of the time), but probably not so good for a dish you want to look good. Same applies to all vegetables; they all turn to mulch after a few pulls of this thing. Still amazing to me, though. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: The plastic broke..not durable
customer_reviews.text: It worked really good for a month, then a crack appeared out of nowhere. Eventually the handle broke. This is not durable. Wouldn’t buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kushal Pradhan

customer_reviews.title: for the amteur chef
customer_reviews.text: I'm was looking for an easy, reliable, economical solution for chopping onions and more. This hand chopper works as described. I have recommended to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: First-Timer

customer_reviews.title: I use this nearly every day - easy to wash
customer_reviews.text: I use this product nearly every day. I had one that I used for nearly two years before it the little plastic pin in the center broke (from so much use). I boutht another one immediately. I use it for chopping everything from onions, zucchinis, carrots, broccoli, mushrooms etc (there's a pasta dish I make where I hide lots of vegatables my son doesn't like, into the sauce. He's never noticed them and loves this meal). This is so much easier than having a bulky food processor taking up space. So easy to clan too! (you're not supposed to put the lid in the dishwasher, but I do).
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my VeggiChop
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my VeggiChop! It was recommended by physical fitness entrepreneur Chalene Johnson. It works wonderfully & is so user friendly. Just a note of caution, be very extremely careful when handling the blade, as I recently cut my thumb while cleaning it. The blade is very sharp for obvious reasons, and unfortunately I neglected to be careful. Despite my minor cut, I will continue to use my chopper regularly. Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Monique Rich

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The spring broke after I had it for about six weeks. Then, desperate to finish what I started chopping, I’d pull it once wind it up by hand, repeat... until the string also broke. It was great while it lasted. Which was about 6 weeks. If you want to chop stuff during a limited period of, say, six weeks, this may be the right product for you. If you’re looking for a long-term kitchen companion, perhaps look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome unit, but be careful
customer_reviews.text: This little guy will mince minced things. In my bliss for NOT having to plug something in for my lazy butt to chop lots of stuff quickly, things did get a little out of hand during my first use. I was like a little kid pulling the rip-cord like crazy, which eventually led to me having to spread chopped onions on a hot dog bun with a spatula. This however was my fault for being too excited and giggling uncontrollably. Finally I'll just say, take it easy while using it (Unless you're making bread crumbs, or grinding coffee.) It certainly makes chopping easy, and the cleanup is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Greatly speeds up chopping and is easy to use even if you don’t have a ton ...
customer_reviews.text: If you make a lot of soups, salsas, etc this thing is a godsend. Greatly speeds up chopping and is easy to use even if you don’t have a ton of arm strength. Only thing I’d say it probably wouldn’t be great for is tomatoes (or any kind of veggie that’s on the watery side), but now that I have it, I don’t know how I lived all this time without!
customer_reviews.author: BeeGirl

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!  Better than electric choppers.
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT! Doesn't take much counter space. Easy to clean. Works better than the small size Ninja or Cuisenart choppers we have had. The electric ones turn things into mush with some bigger chunks in it. This one chops pretty evenly and you can control it better so you don't get any mushy, watery stuff. We've used it for nuts, fresh herbs, and fresh veggies. To make clean-up even easier, I place a piece of Saran Wrap over the top of bowl before putting on the lid, so the lid is completely clean when you take it off. Plan to give these as gifts...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be bigger
customer_reviews.text: Chopper does what it says. Very little effort to chop. I like that I can unscrew top easily because of small grip. I always have an issue with other choppers cause can't get a good hold to open and close. What I don't like it says capacity 4 cups. That is total of container to the very top. So food to be chopped comfortably is closer to 2.5 to maybe 3 cups. Example 2 medium cut up potatoes is about all you want to do at a time. On the other side it chops so quickly. If you only need to do not a large amount it is fine. I wouldn't want to do a large heads cabbage for slaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: works well and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: we already have food processor but we wanted something handy easy to clean and store and I saw my father in law using it so I looked for it here on amazon and ordered it right away. The blades is really good I chopped onions and garlic on using it.Saved time with this baby small but it is really worth it. Also it is a good work out for the arms if you have a lot of onions and veggies to chop. Very easy to clean and doesn't take up space in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Love

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I make lots of salads and like my veggies finely chopped, which means it takes me forever to chop them by hand. The VeggiChop speeds makes the process super easy. Wash the veggies, chop them in a few large pieces, throw them in, a few pulls, and done!! Finely chopped veggies ready to go. I can confirm that it works great with tomatoes, cucumbers, celery, carrots. The only thing it didn't do well with was cheese, since it got stuck on the blades, other than that, as long as the veggies have some consistency to them, it works great!!
customer_reviews.author: nprez

customer_reviews.title: I love this handy little gadget.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I previously had, actually still have, a miniature Cuisinart electric chopper. But this one has more control and is much easier to take care of. I use it for salads, mostly the vegetables that I chop up. Carrots, celery, etc. But I also use it for nuts etc. I have more control when it comes to judging the size of the chop. And muhc easier to clean. I recommend it highly. Also I looked all over for one before I found it on Amazon. Kudos to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Sandford

customer_reviews.title: Its really sturdy too, i thought for sure the cord would ...
customer_reviews.text: Handiest kitchen tool ever. I'm a bachelor and I lift, and have a busy schedule, so meal prep is a must. This thing cuts my meal prep time in half at least. Its really sturdy too, i thought for sure the cord would be week or the draw wouldn't reel it back in very well, but it really holds up. Chops veggies super fine and neat if you need it or pull it only a few times and you can have a chunkier salsa or whatever you're making. Truly a necessity for me anytime I cook.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Happy Dance
customer_reviews.text: The is the best kitchen appliance I have. I have purged my cupboards of several Bullet choppers, food processors, etc. We are a family of only 2 now so I do not need large quantities of chopped onions, celery, jalapenoes, tomatoes, carrots, etc. You will be doing a happy dance with this chopper!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara B

customer_reviews.title: Chops like it should
customer_reviews.text: As a single person, that just need a few things chopped once and a while, this is the way to go. Uses little storage compared to the big ones. My roommate did comment "feels like I'm tying to start a lawnmower when I use this"
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and great price!
customer_reviews.text: My Oma has a pampered chef version of this and my mom has been wanting one forever- but didn't want to spend a ton of money for pampered chef brand. Found this one and ordered it for her- it's awesome and she LOVES it. She has arthritis in her hands and this makes it really fast and easy to chop any veggies or fruits or anything. Can smash an onion in seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen gadgets!  Gift worthy!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works great. Easy to use, clean and very sharp blades. I have two. One is older than the other. What I like best about the new one is the lid locks in place. It's so much easier than pulling out the bigger chopper.
customer_reviews.author: Tina S.

customer_reviews.title: chopper
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this veggie chopper. She chops, rinses it and throws it in the dishwasher. It's also much quieter than a chopper.
customer_reviews.author: CHAZZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea But Doesn't Hold Up
customer_reviews.text: This item stooped working after about 15 uses and I was very surprised because many others have given this product excellent reviews. We took care of this product, but for some reason the pull chord would no longer pull the blades rendering the chopper useless. I wish I had taken a video of how it breaks before tossing it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Hall

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, good value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after seeing my friend using this. Its too good. It chops onions,carrots,cucumbers etc very nicely. I also used it for tomato. But be ready to see it bit mushy due to the pulp. The quality of the container and the lid are really good. Not any cheap plastic. I have already got one more for gifting my mom. Saves a lot of time. Just be careful while handling the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Start with small enough pieces and this works fine...
customer_reviews.text: It isn't a real food processor but it works okay at chopping apples and other fruit/vegetables as long as the pieces you start with aren't too large. Of course, if you have to cut the pieces small to start with, it sort of defeats the purpose of having the device in the first place...
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: easy clean up and storage
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have product in any kitchen. Can not give it more stars, but would if I could. Time saver, easy clean up and storage. May order another for color coordination in case the kitchen changes color. Can NOT stress enough, must have item.
customer_reviews.author: T.A.T. II

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor! I love this so much, I mostly use it to chop onions, but I have also chopped carrots and sweet potatoes, it did a really great job. Seriously, if your trying to decide....just say yes. You'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Makes chopping onions a snap!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, dishwasher safe except for the top. We always hand wash that part... This is my second one, they work great. My sister in law uses the one I bought her to make coleslaw. I only use it for onions.
customer_reviews.author: JKid

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Dont get it why people write stoped working after one use . I have used it 100 times a works perfet for me . Some people are just handycaps :-(
customer_reviews.author: Roman Friedrich

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware- Received Used Model
customer_reviews.text: I was unaware I'd be receiving a used model. Scratched, chipped, and worst of all- pieces of food still stuck on the blades. Tested out the pull string and still seems to be functioning, though. But still- what the heck? Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate to buy this
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for over 3 years and still going strong. This is my go-to chopper for garlic, onions, carrots and any other veg you want to chop up. Need to cut into relatively small pieces for it to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Booboo

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised how very easy it was to use.
customer_reviews.text: Just lightly, gently pull the cord and onion and then carrots were chopped/diced up in seconds. I had in past used one that you had to turn handle on top. I threw that out after handle broke. This new design is the very best. Ive ordered others for friends.
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: this is the very best. Has turned into one of my go to ...
customer_reviews.text: After watching the video on how this works, I couldn't wait to receive it! It didn't let me down. All the fancy gadgets that do the same thing (and I own them!), this is the very best. Has turned into one of my go to kitchen tools. I could not chop onions and this has fixed that. I highly recommend buying this. Could not do without. And it is really easy to clean. Just be careful - blades are very sharp!
customer_reviews.author: pupylve

customer_reviews.title: Stripped gears
customer_reviews.text: Was very good until i put some schredded cheese in it to finely chop. It was too dense and stripped the gears. :(
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Food cutter
customer_reviews.text: I had one I bought 3 years ago that I absolutely loved. This one is definitely smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Must have chopper, but sturdy enough?
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this product; even bought one for my mother-in-law and she loves it. But, after about six months, the handle broke on mine. I wonder if there is a way to replace it...?
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: Essential for every kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this. Onions are chopped easily without watery eyes. It works on all types of fruits and veggies. The large handle makes it very easy to use for kids to people with limited mobility in their hands.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I use it to hide veggies in my son’s food. Works great. Cuts food really small. I really like that it works with hand power alone.
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice Flühmann

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to use chopper
customer_reviews.text: I used this to chop onions and also nuts. Very easy to use and easy to clean. I like that it is not electric!
customer_reviews.author: V B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!  It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with hopes it would work...it has surpassed my expectations! It works great. We have used this to make Salsa, chop tomatoes (roma) for bruschetta, chop carrots up fine to add to dogs food, cut up mixed raw veggies to make veggie cream cheese, and the list goes on. It works great for chopping up anything you would spend time cutting with a knife. The pull is not hard to do. Just owning this we have helped sell more when i pull this out in preparing dinner. People marvel at how well it chops and does not puree things unless you want it to! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: bstager

customer_reviews.title: It chops onion beautifully. So I tried celery - no problem
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely cannot believe this gadget! As soon as I got it, I did some tests. It chops onion beautifully. So I tried celery - no problem! I thought that the stringy texture might prove a challenge, but this little thing totally chopped it up fine and did not leave any "strings" from the celery. I have only had this chopped for a couple of days, but it is hands down the best I've seen. Very few parts to clean, simple to assemble, and does the job. I only hope the blade does not dull with a lot of use, because I think this will get a lot of use in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Mom loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my mom and she uses it a lot for small items that don't require more horsepower. The pulley was what made her crack up and a gives her a great workout
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Thai

customer_reviews.title: Needs replacement
customer_reviews.text: I got this delivered on 10th Dec . First time used it on12th Dec. Tomatoes were finely cut . Later I cut onions and when done I realized the lid has got struck to the jar . Tried opening it but the top lid with thread cane out and inner lid still struck in jar with onions inside . Photos attached . If there is no way out to remove the lid , I need my money or a replacement with durable one .
customer_reviews.author: Sriram

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to work
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend. Blade kept coming out, difficult to use and clean. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Penn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this chopper. I used to have a slap-chopper and not only was it loud, but it would hurt my hands all the time. This one is quiet and it gets the job done SO fast!! Today I was chopping some onions and they ended up being so fine it was like a paste. I will probably buy another one for a friend, soon. Oh and the lid for the fridge is just perfect. I usually make salsa for two days! Awesome product
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: One Dad Bass chopper
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Chops very well, you can choose your chopped size, cleans easy, very sturdy, has rubber top and bottom for extra grip, couldn't ask for a better chopper. Just don't let your wife throw in the blades in your rice cooker pot submerged in soapy water to "let it soak" and then reach in as you are washing those dishes. Needed a few band aids the blades are very sharp lol. Gotta love them right?
customer_reviews.author: LOCOmotivRICO

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen items
customer_reviews.text: This chopper is super simple and makes food prep so much easier. I cut my prep time in half, and I love it! I've had this for several years, and it has stayed sharp and is still sturdy. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jac Ro

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: My sister bought one of these and suggested I get one since we're full-time RVer's with limited space. It works great! I chopped onions in it and it took just a few seconds to get them perfect. Plus, you don't need power to use this baby, and it doesn't take up much space. Perfect for using in a RV. Update 10/24/2015: I liked this so much that I bought a second one for my vacation home. It's still one of my favorite accessories. I just made 2 appetizers this morning for a church luncheon and it chopped up the veggies perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the neatest little kitchen tool I've ever purchased. It chops wonderfully! Never again will my food processor make it to my cabinet. This little chopper actually does a better job! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: JC in Texas

customer_reviews.title: 5 star chopper!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little chopper. I like the fact it get my vegtables very small. Super easy to use, pull the handle as many times as you need until chopping is complete. The bowl and lid are very easy to clean. The blade is super sharp, I cut myfinger when I was trying to clean it. i would recommend this to family and friends. I would not hesitate to buy another for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Kay

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I have one and absolutely LOVE it! it's the easiest thing in the world to chop foods. The more times you pull the cord, the finer the chopping. I bought one for my son, he uses it a lot to make salsa. I bought four to give as Christmas gifts. It's a gift item that won't necessarily be thrilling when opened, but I guarantee you it will be appreciated greatly the next time your recipient cooks!
customer_reviews.author: Donna C. Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly useful kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: My VeggiChop is still going strong after 2 years. Ordered one more VeggiChop recently for my mom as a present, and she quickly fell in love with it (mainly for dicing onions). She had me order several more VeggiChops for her to give to her friends.
customer_reviews.author: Gear Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant product
customer_reviews.text: I use this to cut vegetables expecially onions & tomoatos. Very easy to use, worth the money & better than those huge vegetable chopper.
customer_reviews.author: LSS

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Chops onions and celery like a charm! Careful, though, the blades are quite sharp and will cut any fingers that happen to be in the way.
customer_reviews.author: BrightestPickle

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: Chef'n VeggiChop, where have you been all my life? Four easy pulls of the cord and I had perfectly chopped onion!!! I've purchased and returned mini food processors (turned onions into juice) and those manual choppers where you press the plunger down (way more work than the knife, and a pain to clean). I absolutely detest chopping onions by hand. No more!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Pea

customer_reviews.title: This product is great! I used it for the first time yesterday ...
customer_reviews.text: I just want to start out by saying that I never write a product review. This product is great! I used it for the first time yesterday for chopping onions. It chopped them very fine with maybe 6 pulls on the chord. I would never be able to chop the onions myself this fine. I just love the handle, it's as large as the cover to the chopper and we be great if someone had large hands! Very easy to clean! Would buy this again and would recommend it to anyone! GREAT PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue g

customer_reviews.title: After reading the reviews I decided I wanted one for ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided I wanted one for the camper. The local watering hole & pizzeria was complaining last week about the hand onion chopper they bought locally and I offered to bring this one in when it arrived. It came today, I took it in tonight, and not only did they want one but other people at the bar saw us playing with it and decided they couldn't live without one. I just ordered 6 more.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: I originally received this as a gift and liked it so much
customer_reviews.text: I originally received this as a gift and liked it so much, I purchased one for someone else. The pull string is very easy to use and doesn't require a lot of strength. It makes quick work out of onions, peppers, nuts - all sorts of things. I like that it doesn't take up much space in my cabinet and also has a lid so that you can store things in it as well. I would recommend this to anyone. I feel like a sucker for all those years I chopped vegetables with a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: A great little machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE STILL ALIVE!!! ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I give it a five star only because there is no more than five. When buying the food chopper I was a little hesitant because of some bad reviews. But "MY" chopper is just perfect. I feel more confortable using it than my electric 3 cups Hamilton Beach food chopper. It's a great little machine. I think I could buy it again and I would highly recommand it. It can be a nice gift!
customer_reviews.author: Johane Rosiers

customer_reviews.title: Love this little thing!
customer_reviews.text: This food chopper is amazing! It's my new favorite kitchen tool. Super easy to use, assemble, and clean! I like that it comes with a lid for storing dips, salsas, etc. I also like that I don't have to worry about plugging anything in or cords cluttering up the countertop. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: deadpool

product_meta.title: Chef'n VeggiChop Hand-Powered Food Chopper (Arugula)
product_meta.description: Color:ArugulaBreeze through food preparation tasks with the beautifully designed Chef'n VeggiChop Hand-Powered Food Chopper (Arugula). Chop large pieces of fruit, vegetables, boneless meats, herbs, nuts, and even ice by hand with this handy chopper. Running without electricity, this hand-powered chopper is great for small kitchens, RVs, travel, and camping. Simply place ingredients in the container, twist and lock the lid, and pull the cord to spin the chopping blades. Perfect for whipping up batches of pesto, hummus, salsa, guacamole, and more, this chopper also comes with a sealing storage lid to keep ingredients in the container. Wash the blades, bowl, and storage lid on the top rack of the dishwasher.
feature_bullets: Chop large pieces of fruit, vegetables, boneless meats, herbs, nuts, and even ice by hand with this handy chopper
Running without electricity, this hand powered chopper is great for small kitchens, RVs, travel, and camping.
Simply place ingredients in the container, twist and lock the lid, and pull the cord to spin the chopping blades
Perfect for whipping up batches of pesto, hummus, salsa, guacamole, and more, this chopper also comes with a sealing storage lid to keep ingredients in the container
Wash the blades, bowl, and storage lid on the top rack of the dishwasher

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,339 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
